item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Gifts Free Items to Celebrate 10 Million Copies Sold
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/monster-hunter-wilds-gifts-free-items-to-celebrate-10-million-copies-sold/

Monster Hunter Wilds has announced a free login bonus for players to celebrate selling 10 million units within a month. 

Players who log in to Monster Hunter Wilds today will receive several items through the “10 Million Celebration Item Pack”. The pack includes 30 Mega Potions, 20 Lifepowders, 20 Mega Barrel Bombs, 10 Hard Armor Spheres and 10 Silver Eggs. The free rewards will be available from April 1, 00:00 UTC, to April 13, 23:59 UTC. 

How to Claim the Free 10 Million Item Pack in MHW?

Players must go through several steps to claim the free 10 Million Celebration Item Pack In Monster Hunter Wilds. Open the Start Menu and click on ‘Items & Equipment’. Look for ‘Login Bonus’ in this menu and then claim your free items. 

What’s Next for Monster Hunter Wilds?

Game Director Yuka Tokuda shared future plans for Monster Hunter Wilds when announcing the 10 million global sales milestone. Tokuda stated that the Title Update 1 is all set to arrive on April 4, followed by a new Seasonal event lasting from April 23 to May 7. Then, a Capcom collaboration and other additional features will come with ver. 1.011 at the end of May. Moreover, Title Update 2 (ver. 1.02) is planned for Summer and will introduce an additional monster and a seasonal event. 

What are your thoughts on Monster Hunter Wilds’ free “10 Million Celebration Item Pack”? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

item.title: Final Fantasy 9 Remake Rumors Heat Up With New FF9 Website Launch
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/final-fantasy-9-remake-rumors-heat-up-with-new-ff9-website-launch/

To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Final Fantasy 9, Square Enix has launched a special website dedicated to the title. But all this has done is spark gossip and speculation that a Final Fantasy 9 remake is on the way and close to being announced.

Needless to say, the Final Fantasy 7 Remake project has been a hit. It’s won awards, both games have sold millions of copies, and the third and final chapter of the trilogy is sure to round things off in style. But while the FF7 remake talk has been constant, the chatter about a Final Fantasy 9 remake has been just as loud and fervent.

The ninth mainline game is considered as important as any to many in the FF community. So when Square Enix suddenly drops a new FF9 website, eyebrows are raised, and questions are sure to be asked.

New Final Fantasy 9 25th Anniversary Website Sparks Remake Rumors Again

A new official Final Fantasy 9 website celebrating the JRPG’s 25th anniversary launched in March 2025. It pays homage to the game and gives fans worldwide the chance to buy exclusive merchandise, learn about the title, and see what Square Enix has planned.

Nothing else has been confirmed for now. However, it’s been reported that a Final Fantasy 9 Remake has been in the works—although it may not involve Final Fantasy 14 director Naoki Yoshida. The development of the title has reportedly happened alongside the FF7 Remake Part 3.

A new website and all this commotion and celebration for Final Fantasy 9 likely doesn’t stop here. With the annual Summer of blockbuster gaming announcements upcoming, all signs are pointing toward the inevitable Final Fantasy 9 Remake confirmation.

item.title: New 2026 Resident Evil Movie Will be in “Spirit of Games”
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/new-2026-resident-evil-movie-will-be-in-spirit-of-games/

We already know that 2026 brings us a new reboot of Resident Evil. However, thanks to words from director Zach Cregger, it could be one of the most faithful adaptations of the legendary survival-horror series to date.

The history of Resident Evil movies isn’t the best. There’s been plenty to love, and we’ve seen countless nods to the game from characters to Resident Evil Apocalypse’s full inclusion of Nemesis. Milla Jovovich killed it as Alice in the original six movies, but the franchise has moved in a different direction since.

2021’s Resident Evil Welcome to Raccoon City has already been forgotten, but now we look ahead to the new 2026 Resident Evil film.

Resident Evil Movie is “Unlike Any of The Previous Films”

Through IGN, we’ve learned from Zach Cregger—director of the Resident Evil movie reboot—that his interpretation “Will be built in the spirit of those games and follows one central protagonist from point A to point B, as they descend deeper into hell.”

He wants to capture a truer feel of the survival games, and has boldly claimed the reboot is “Unlike any of the previous films.”

Zach Cregger is an actor-turned-director and producer. He’s had several roles across TV and movies, but he’s recently best-known for writing and directing 2022’s Barbarian. The Resident Evil reboot is a huge project, and if the movie can be a success, it could start a new trend of Resident Evil movies to go along with the game series.

We know a new Resident Evil game is well into development, and it’s also rumored that Resident Evil 0 and Code Veronica remakes are on the way. Join the conversation in our Insider Gaming forum to see if anyone else is excited at the prospect of more Resident Evil screentime.
